author: Shina Oludare
title: Man United loanee Anthony determined to stay at Real Betis
text:
Man United loanee Anthony determined to stay at Real Betis
Anthony is not interested in leaving Real Betis to return to his parent club, Manchester United.
The winger is set for crucial talks with the Premier League club regarding his future but is not willing to return to Old Trafford after an impressive loan spell in Spain.According to ABC de Sevilla, the Brazil international's agents will also attend the meeting as the three parties discuss his next move.
Advertisement
Advertisement
Having joined Real Betis from Manchester United, Anthony has scored four goals and provided two assists in 11 appearances for the La Liga side.

author: BSS
title: Army prepared to tackle flood situation in Feni | News
text:
CUMILLA, July 10, 2025 (BSS) - Bangladesh Army is fully prepared to respond to the ongoing flood situation in Feni district.
Drawing upon insights gained from last year’s devastating floods, the army has already initiated necessary preparedness measures to provide maximum support, according to a press release issued today by the 33rd Infantry Division at Cumilla Cantonment.
Due to continuous heavy rainfall and the onrush of water from upstream hill regions, low-lying areas in Fulgazi and Parshuram upazilas of Feni district have been inundated resulting in flooding.
To support rescue and relief operations, tri-shark boats, OBM engines, and life jackets have already been deployed at the army camps in Parshuram and Fulgazi as of today.
On Wednesday, a coordination meeting was held between the army and the district’s flood and disaster management committee under the supervision of the Feni Deputy Commissioner. The meeting focused on strategies to address the evolving flood situation.
Additionally, to ensure uninterrupted medical services during emergencies, an army medical team has held a coordination meeting with the Civil Surgeon of Feni district.
The Bangladesh Army reaffirmed its commitment to stand beside the people during times of national crisis.
For necessary assistance, citizens are encouraged to contact the Flood Monitoring Cell at the Feni Deputy Commissioner’s office via the following helpline numbers: 01898-444500 and 01336-586693.

author: EFE
title: Muere a los 78 años la cantante británica Marianne Faithfull
text:
Fallecimiento
Muere a los 78 años la cantante británica Marianne Faithfull
La artista, que también destacó como actriz, se hizo popular tras interpretar 'As Tears Go By', escrita por Mick Jagger y Keith Richards, fue pareja del líder de los Rolling Stones e inspiró canciones como 'Wild Horses'
EFE
La cantante, actriz y compositora británica Marianne Faithfull, considerada musa de los Rolling Stones y conocida por sus noviazgos con estrellas como Mick Jagger y su larga adicción a las drogas, falleció este jueves en Londres a los 78 años.
Nacida en 1946 en el barrio londinense de Hampstead, Faithfull era hija de una bailarina aristócrata astrohúngara, Eva Von Sacher-Masoch y de un oficial de espionaje británico, Glynn Faithfull, pero pasó su infancia con su madre, separada, en Reading (al oeste de Londres).
Con diecisiete años se marchó a vivir a la capital británica y se inició en el mundo de la música cantando por las noches en los bares; pero su momento de fama llegaría en 1964 tras conocer en una fiesta al mánager de los Rolling Stones, Andrew Oldham.
Su single debut, la balada 'As Tears Go By', escrita por los 'Rolling' Mick Jagger y Keith Richards, la catapultó al top 10 de las listas de éxitos del Reino Unido en ese mismo año.
En 1965 se casó con el profesor inglés John Dumber, mientras esperaba a su primer y único hijo, Nicholas, pero pronto lo dejaría para iniciar una relación con Jagger que, aunque solo duró cuatro años, provocó que la figura de Faithfull siempre estuviera asociada al cantante de los Rolling Stones.
Faithfull es considerada como la 'musa' de los Rolling Stones, ya que inspiró canciones como 'Let's Spend the Night Together' o 'Wild Horses' y llegó a coescribir con la banda la letra de 'Sister Morphine', incluida en el álbum de los Stones 'Sticky Fingers' (1971).
"Sé que me utilizaban como musa para esas canciones duras sobre la droga. Sabía que me estaban utilizando, pero era por una buena causa", dijo la cantante en una entrevista con 'Classic Rock'.
Una vida marcada por las drogas
El final de la década de los años 60 fue su momento dorado y también comenzó a dar sus primeros pasos en teatro y el cine, con películas como 'La chica de la motocicleta' (1968), pero su adicción a las drogas la llevó a tocar fondo.
"A la mierda los 60. Quien quiera saber de mi pasado que lea mis memorias", confesó Faithfull entre risas durante una entrevista con EFE en 2008.
En esta época, la británica llegó a pasar unos días en prisión por posesión de sustancias, tras ser detenida por la Policía en una redada junto a miembros de los Rolling, según dice una leyenda urbana, vistiendo solo una alfombra de piel.
En los 70 se separó de Jagger, intentó suicidarse con una sobredosis tras perder la custodia de su hijo, vagabundeó por las calles de Londres y Nueva York y acudió a una clínica de desintoxicación en Minneapolis y a Alcohólicos Anónimos en su lucha por salir de su dependencia.
El resurgimiento de su carrera
Regresó a la música con su disco 'Broken English' (1979), cargado de contenido político, que le valió una nominación a los Premios Grammy y supuso el resurgimiento de una carrera que abarcaría 21 álbumes de estudio y estilos como el rock, el jazz, el blues o el cabaret.
En busca de alejarse de la imagen dañada de la Faithfull de los 60, escribió varias autobiografías y reinició su carrera en el cine y el teatro, donde llegó a optar al Premio Europeo de Cine a mejor actriz en 2008 por su papel en 'Irina Palm'.
En los últimos años, los problemas de salud marcaron la vida de Faithfull. En 2006 se sometió a una cirugía tras un diagnóstico de cáncer de mama; un año más tarde anunció que padecía hepatitis desde hacía más de una década y, en 2020, contrajo el Covid-19 y estuvo hospitalizada. Desde 2022 estaba en una residencia de ancianos.

author: @WCTV
title: A nice finish to your weekend
text: A nice finish to your weekend Meteorologist Austin Lowe has the latest forecast TALLAHASSEE, Fla. (WCTV) - Weather headlines feature a nice end to the weekend... Cool and bright tomorrow. The rain showers make a return late into Tuesday. This will not be a total washout, but you need the rain gear. Behind that... Well, it’s going to be the coldest air of the season and likely the coldest air we’ve seen in a bit for the big bend in south Georgia. Expect below-average temperatures in our area over the next several days. I want to start with where things are right now... Cool in the 50s with a good amount of cloud cover. Clouds are expected to linger overnight which will prevent us from falling off too cold overnight. The regional view shows clearing on the way. Rain is not going to be a problem the next few days, nor is severe weather. Rain returns on Monday night/Tuesday timeframe... And look snow to the north, yikes. That will not make its way to us, but the cold air associated with it will. Which I will talk about momentarily. Showers most likely arrive on Tuesday for most. These will be scattered in nature and not a washout of a day. After the front passes... much colder on Wednesday with highs in the 40s. Lows will be cold enough to support a hard freeze by Tuesday and Wednesday nights. So think about the plants, pets, and livestock those nights. Cover them or bring them indoors. Layer up as you head outside, the wind will make it feel even colder on Wednesday. And use caution while using those space heaters. To recap, quiet over the next few days with the mid-60s. Tuesday there’s a chance of showers 50% right now not going to be a washout of a day just have the rain gear handy and the really cold stuff Wednesday and Thursday with highs in the 40s to mid-50s and Friday we bring the rain chance back at about 40%. To stay up to date on all the latest news as it develops, follow WCTV on [X](https://twitter.com/WCTV) ( Have a news tip or see an error that needs correction? [Write us here](mailto:news@wctv.tv?subject=Correction%20Needed). Please include the article's headline in your message. Keep up with all the biggest headlines on the WCTV News app. Click [here](https://wctv.tv/2023/04/18/wctv-news-app) to download it now. Copyright 2024 WCTV. All rights reserved.

author: @zazoomblog
title: Moda nessuna azienda resti senza cassa
text:
Moda nessuna azienda resti senza cassa
Crisi della Moda, mancano all’appello almeno più di 60 categorie merceologiche per la cassa integrazione straordinaria. E’ l’analisi dell’assessora regionale alle Crisi aziendali, Alessandra Nardini che ha scritto una lettera alla ministra del lavoro, Marina Calderone per chiedere una revisione della circolare Inps illustrativa dei contenuti delle disposizioni in materia di integrazione al reddito in favore dei lavoratori dipendenti di datori di lavoro, anche artigiani, operanti nei settori tessile, dell’abbigliamento e calzaturiero. La circolare è stata pubblicata tre giorni fa, a un mese di distanza dal decreto legge in materia approvato dal Governo per accesso a 9 settimane di cassa integrazione straordinaria alle aziende operanti nel settore della Moda. La circolare operativa dell’Inps chiarisce i requisiti per rientrare nel campo di applicazione di questo provvedimento: le aziende devono essere classificate nei settori industria o artigianato, avere una forza occupazionale media inferiore o pari ai 15 dipendenti, aver già raggiunto i limiti di durata massima dei trattamenti di integrazione salariale previsti dalla legge.Leggi su Lanazione.it
Lanazione.it - "Moda, nessuna azienda resti senza cassa"
- GIALLO SULL’AMIATA: ANCORA NESSUNA TRACCIA DEL TRASPORTATORE SCOMPARSO CON UN CARICO DI BORSE DI LUSSO PER 500 MILA EURO
- "Moda, nessuna azienda resti senza cassa" - Crisi moda Firenze: 60 settori esclusi dalla cassa integrazione. Assessorato regionale chiede revisione circolare Inps per includerli. (lanazione.it)
- Restare o andarsene? Domande sulla carriera in un mondo della moda che cambia - Negli altri settori specialistici in cui sono responsabile del collocamento dei dirigenti, il cambiamento non è così evidente. Al contrario, il settore dell'e-commerce, per esempio, è in crescita, ... (fashionunited.it)
- Moda, sette proposte per rilanciare le pmi. Capasa: "Aiutateci a non licenziare nessuno" - Ascolta ora Il Sistema Moda mette in campo sette proposte per preservare l'occupazione in un momento di crisi in un settore che conta 600mila dipendenti. Gli emendamenti alla legge di bilancio 2025 pr ... (msn.com)

author: PTI
title: Srinagar: Mirwaiz barred from offering Friday prayers at Jamia Masjid | Sports-Games
text: Srinagar: Mirwaiz barred from offering Friday prayers at Jamia Masjid [PTI](/pti-stories)| Srinagar | Updated: 29-12-2023 16:26 IST | Created: 29-12-2023 16:26 IST - Country: - India Hurriyat Conference Chairman Mirwaiz Umar Farooq Friday said he was not allowed to offer congregational prayers at the Jamia Masjid here. The Friday prayers were allowed at the historic grand mosque in the Nowhatta area of the city, but Mirwaiz, who is the chief priest of Kashmir and delivers the Friday sermon at the mosque, was not allowed to move out of his residence in Nigeen, located in the outskirts of the city. Mirwaiz denounced his repeated ''house detention,'' especially on Fridays, to prevent him from delivering the Friday sermon and offering obligatory Friday prayers. In a statement, Mirwaiz said that after his release on September 22, — after four years of house detention since August 2019 — he has been allowed to go to Jamia Masjid only on three Fridays. ''Since then, every Friday, I have been put under house arrest without being provided any reason for it by the authorities. ''One doesn't know till when the ban on me continues. At their will and whim, the authorities close down or open the central Jamia Masjid to Muslims for prayers, and no one can ask why,'' he said. Congregational prayers were allowed at the Jamia Masjid on Friday last week after 10 consecutive weeks. Mirwaiz said that this ''arbitrariness, disregard'' for religious rights and sentiments of Muslims, and ''strong-arm tactics'' of the authorities, even on the basic human right to practice religion unfettered ''is a telling sign of the time and situation we are living in.'' ''It is also a mockery of the authorities' statements that 'things are great in J-K and I am a free man' who can go anywhere. ''Those in charge of decision-making should revisit this policy and think long-term in the light of historical precedents,'' Mirwaiz said. (This story has not been edited by Devdiscourse staff and is auto-generated from a syndicated feed.) - READ MORE ON: - [Congregational](/news?tag=Congregational) - [Mirwaiz Umar Farooq](/news?tag=Mirwaiz+Umar+Farooq) - [Mirwaiz](/news?tag=Mirwaiz) - [Muslims](/news?tag=Muslims) - [Nigeen](/news?tag=Nigeen) - [Jamia Masjid](/news?tag=Jamia+Masjid) - [mosque](/news?tag=mosque) - [Kashmir](/news?tag=Kashmir) - [Nowhatta](/news?tag=Nowhatta)

author: @playbill
title: J. Harrison Ghee, Robyn Hurder, More Join 2024 Edition of I Put a Spell On You | Playbill
text: [Jay Armstrong Johnson](https://playbill.com/person/jay-armstrong-johnson-vault- 45825) is readying to don his Winifred Sanderson drag once again for the 2024 iteration of I Put a Spell On You: ALiiVE at Webster Hall, set for the NYC venue October 21. The annual Halloween concert full of Broadway favorites will benefit the Ali Forney Center and their work to end homelessness among LGBTQ+ youth. Joining this year's event will be Tony winner [J. Harrison Ghee](https://playbill.com/person/j-harrison-ghee) (Some Like It Hot) and [Robyn Hurder](https://playbill.com/person/robyn-hurder-vault-0000108944) (Moulin Rouge!), [Stephen Brower](https://playbill.com/person/stephen-brower) (Lempicka), [Yeman Brown](https://playbill.com/person/yeman-brown) (Queen of Versailles), [Max Clayton](https://playbill.com/person/max-clayton-vault-0000125909) (Music Man), [Heath Saunders](https://playbill.com/person/heath-saunders) (Company), and Emma Sofia (Cats: "The Jellicle Ball"). Karma Jenkins (The Time Traveler’s Wife) will be Dani Dennison, with Maddox Martin and Kathryn Priest as Max and Allison, respectively. More casting is to be announced. And, of course, back alongside Johnson will be Allison Godleski and Amanda Williams Ware as Sarah and Mary Sanderson, respectively. Heath Saunders is directing the affair, which will feature choreography from [Mike Baerga](https://playbill.com/person/mike-baerga), Hope Melody Easterbrooke, Tyler Eisenreich, [Eamon Foley](https://playbill.com/person/eamon-foley-vault- 57564), Jay Armstrong Johnson, [Reed Luplau](https://playbill.com/person/reed-luplau-vault-0000126645), [Leo Moctezuma](https://playbill.com/person/leo-moctezuma-performer), Jenny Oehlwein, Julius Rubio, [Kellen Stancil](https://playbill.com/person/kellen-stancil-vault-0000117793), [Theresa Stone](https://playbill.com/person/theresa-stone-vault- 52399), Michael Anthony Sylvester, and David Wright Jr. Michael Anthony Sylvester is supervising choreographer. DW is creative director. Jackson Teely is serving as music supervisor, with [Will Van Dyke](https://playbill.com/person/will-van-dyke-vault- 1063) as music consultant. The music producer team includes Lloyd Kikoler, Conor Keelan, and Mike Pacifico. [Ahmad Simmons](https://playbill.com/person/ahmad-simmons) is a creative advisor. [Kyle Krueger](https://playbill.com/person/kyle-krueger) is makeup designer. The concert will feature costume design and art direction by DW, with additional costume design by Taylor Barnett, Kelsey Buerger, [Antonio Consuegra](https://playbill.com/person/antonio-consuegra-designer), Brian Hemesath, Sarah Marie Dixey, Cameron Loeb, and Alan Tude. Christina Vida Rolodos is SFX makeup lead. The performance will also feature props designed by Andy Diaz, video design by [Brian Pacelli](https://playbill.com/person/brian-pacelli), additional video design by Jamie Kiliany, sound design by [Josh Liebert](https://playbill.com/person/josh-liebert-vault- 22077), and lighting design by Andrew Garvis. Johnson is executive producing and writing. Katie Rosin and Kampfire Films are producing with [Andy Jones](https://playbill.com/person/andrew-jones-vault- 7580) of [Baseline Theatrical](https://playbill.com/person/baseline-theatrical-vault-0000125528) serving as general manager and Sean Gorski of [Hudson Theatrical Associates](https://playbill.com/person/hudson-theatrical-associates-vault- 2243) as production manager. The executive producing committee includes Sean Cocchia, Todd Donovan, Andy Jones, and Tom Schumacher. Tickets are available at [IPASOY202.cbo.io](https://cbo.io/bidapp/index.php?slug=ipasoy2024), which also includes sponsorship and VIP packages. See photos from last year's I Put a Spell on You:

author: Diana Cabrera
title: Centrales obreras alertan posible hundimiento de la laboral
text:
[Diana
Cabrera
](/autores/diana-cabrera)
Centrales obreras alertan posible hundimiento de la reforma laboral
Gremios aseguran que partidos como el Centro Democrático y Cambio Radical quieren hundir el proyecto.
El presidente de la Central Unitaria de Trabajadores (CUT), Fabio Arias, se declaró a la expectativa del inicio del tercer debate de la reforma laboral en la Comisión Séptima del Senado de la República.
El líder sindical señaló que espera que arranque esta nueva discusión donde le apuntarán hacer una férrea defensa de esta iniciativa del Gobierno liderada por la ministra de Trabajo, Gloria Inés Ramírez.
“Nosotros aspiramos a que antes del 16 de diciembre termine el debate en la Comisión Séptima del Senado de la República, entendiendo que será una discusión amplia de los más de 80 artículos que hacen parte de este proyecto”, dijo.
Lea más: [Congreso define prioridades estratégicas para finalizar la legislatura de 2024](https://www.lafm.com.co/politica/congreso-define-prioridades-estrategicas-para-finalizar-la-legislatura-de-2024)
Apuntó que su mayor preocupación está enfocada en el ambiente que se está creando alrededor de esta propuesta teniendo en cuenta que se corre el riesgo, de que se hunda en la misma comisión que se hundió la reforma de la salud.
“Tenemos una preocupación muy grande; y entendemos que ahí va a estar la mayor dificultad de la reforma laboral, por el antecedente que tenemos de que esta comisión hundió la reforma a la salud”, sostuvo.
Recalcó que este su mayor temor con una reforma que será muy importante para los trabajadores colombianos. “Tenemos los partidos políticos como Centro Democrático y Cambio Radical han insistido que ellos van a buscar como hundir la reforma laboral en la Comisión Séptima del Senado”, afirmó.
Le puedo interesar: [Procuraduría pide retirar interceptaciones telefónicas en caso Uribe](https://www.lafm.com.co/judicial/procuraduria-pide-retirar-interceptaciones-telefonicas-en-caso-uribe)
Arias fue claro en señalar que ellos lucharán por mantener la reforma laboral y lograr que esta siga viva y caminando por el Congreso de la República.
“Nosotros vamos a pelear para que no se hunda, porque destacamos la recuperación del recargo nocturno a partir de las siete de la noche, la recuperación de los dominicales y festivos, transitoriamente en un periodo de tres años, la recuperación del carácter laboral del contrato de aprendizaje, los contratos a término indefinidos como norma general y que cuando hay más de cuatro prórrogas tienen que ser a término indefinido.
Dijo que además se redujeron las brechas de género y la formalización laboral de las trabajadoras domésticas, de los trabajadores de plataformas digitales y de los trabajadores conductores de vehículos de carga”, afirmó.

author: michaelapetty43
title: Eucalyptus Silk Sheets: The Perfect Bedding Choice for All Seasons
text:
When it involves selecting the best bedding, discovering a cloth that keeps you comfortable in all seasons might be challenging. The market is filled with options, from cotton to linen to synthetic fibers, every with its own pros and cons. However not too long ago, a new contender has emerged as a popular alternative for those seeking comfort, sustainability, and yr-round usability: eucalyptus silk sheets. Known for their luxurious really feel, eco-friendly production, and temperature-regulating properties, eucalyptus silk sheets are quickly turning into a favorite. Here’s why these sheets are the perfect bedding selection for all seasons.
1. What Are Eucalyptus Silk Sheets?
Eucalyptus silk sheets, additionally known as Tencel or lyocell sheets, are made from the fibers of eucalyptus trees. The term “silk” in their name refers to their luxurious softness, usually compared to traditional silk. Unlike silk derived from silkworms, eucalyptus silk is vegan and plant-primarily based, making it an appealing option for these looking for cruelty-free bedding options.
These sheets are produced through an eco-friendly process. Eucalyptus trees, which develop quickly and require little water, are harvested and broken down into pulp. This pulp is then transformed into fiber using a closed-loop production methodology, which implies that nearly all of the solvents and water used within the process are recycled, minimizing environmental impact.
2. Temperature Regulation: Keep Cool in the Summer season, Warm in the Winter
One of the standout qualities of eucalyptus silk sheets is their distinctive temperature-regulating ability. This is as a result of natural properties of eucalyptus fibers, which wick moisture away from the skin while permitting for airflow. This makes eucalyptus silk sheets a superb choice for warm climate, as they keep you cool and dry by drawing heat away out of your body and promoting breathability.
In colder months, eucalyptus silk sheets also provide a comfortable sleeping experience. While they don’t trap heat the way flannel or fleece would possibly, they provide a gentle, insulating effect that keeps your body warmth in balance without overheating. The consequence? Sheets that adapt to the climate, helping you sleep soundly regardless of the season.
3. Hypoallergenic and Antibacterial Properties
Eucalyptus silk sheets usually are not only comfortable but additionally useful for individuals with sensitive skin or allergies. Eucalyptus fibers have natural hypoallergenic and antibacterial properties, making them resistant to mud mites, mold, and bacteria. This is a significant advantage for anyone prone to allergy symptoms or sensitive to traditional cotton sheets that can trap allergens.
The hypoallergenic properties of eucalyptus silk sheets extend past seasonal changes. Whether it’s pollen within the spring or dry air in the winter, these sheets provide a cleaner, safer sleeping environment yr-round. And because they’re resistant to odor and bacteria, you’ll discover that eucalyptus silk sheets stay fresher longer, reducing the necessity for frequent washing and extending the life of your bedding.
4. Softness and Comfort That Lasts
One other reason eucalyptus silk sheets have gained popularity is their luxurious softness, which rivals that of high-quality cotton or silk sheets. They have a smooth, silky texture that is gentle on the skin, reducing friction and offering a soothing feel. This quality makes them a wonderful selection for those with sensitive skin or anyone who enjoys the texture of high-end bedding.
What’s more, eucalyptus silk sheets maintain their softness and durability over time. Unlike some cotton sheets that can turn out to be tough after a number of washes, eucalyptus silk sheets remain smooth, reducing pilling and wear. With proper care, they can last for years, making them a worthwhile investment in long-term comfort.
5. An Eco-Friendly Selection for Conscious Consumers
For those concerned with environmental impact, eucalyptus silk sheets are a accountable choice. Eucalyptus trees develop quickly and may be cultivated sustainably with minimal water. Additionalmore, the production process of eucalyptus silk is environmentally aware, using fewer chemical compounds and less water than cotton or traditional silk production.
Many companies that manufacture eucalyptus silk sheets are additionally committed to sustainable practices, guaranteeing that their products are ethically made and freed from dangerous chemicals. If you select eucalyptus silk sheets, you’re not only choosing comfort and quality but in addition supporting a product that aligns with eco-friendly values.
6. Easy Care and Upkeep
While eucalyptus silk sheets may sound like they require special care attributable to their luxurious texture, they’re surprisingly easy to maintain. These sheets can typically be machine washed on a gentle cycle with cold water and mild detergent. They dry quickly and resist wrinkles, making them low-upkeep compared to traditional silk or high-thread-depend cotton sheets which will want ironing or particular attention.
7. The Verdict: Eucalyptus Silk Sheets for Each Season
Eucalyptus silk sheets provide a uncommon combination of comfort, sustainability, and adaptability that makes them excellent for yr-spherical use. Whether you’re looking to remain cool throughout hot summer season nights or cozy up within the winter, these sheets provide the perfect balance.
